info.name: ZIMT Hub
info.description:
# ZIMT Hub 
Hub usage examples 

## Getting started 
1. There are 2 files you need to import, hub.json and hub-environment.json.
    - hub.json is a collection of all hub endpoints and tutorials.
    - hub-environment.json is environment file you have to add and use hub.json in.
2. After 1. imports, switch environment to ZIMT Hub environment, open the environment in edit mode, and update:
    - **api**: Hub API url (*test*: https://hub.test.zi.mt or *prod*: https://hub.zi.mt)
    - **private-key**: Private key of your hub account 
    - **api-key**: Your hub API KEY
3. You can now try using endpoints which are organized in named folders.
    - API covers all ZIMT Hub API endpoints.
    - Tutorials have different type of tutorials you can follow.
4. **Note**: Certain endpoints are for Hub admins only, some are for organization admins only, and some are also for regular users, visit our [documentation](https://dev.zi.mt) for more details.

request.description:
Returns list of assets.

With query params, it limits response to 10 assets, skips 2 (pagination) and attaches to each asset events of type info (if that specific asset has them).

exec: // Extract the private key so we can make requests in following requests

item.description:
# Basic tutorial 
In this tutorial, you can follow each folder and do each request one after another. 

## Agenda 
Requests in this tutorial will cover:
- Authentication
- Managing users
- Creating / reading assets
- Creating / reading events 
- Creating / reading documents
- Search & filtering with pagination
